newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RUGBY LEAGUE - Strong sales for first Warriors game.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY LEAGUE - Strong sales for first Warriors game.

text.p: AUCKLAND, Jan 16 - The Auckland Warriors will have plenty of support for their first pre-season Super League match against the North Queensland Cowboys in Invercargill, NZPA reports.
Southland Rugby Union chief executive John Brookland said ticket sales had been strong for the Saturday, January 25, game.

"And as far as Southland Rugby is concerned, we're pleased to see such top-level sport come to Southland and Invercargill and the response so far justifies their decision to play the match here," Brookland said.
"There are also additional factors like having Matthew Ridge lead the side for the first time and that it might well be the first Super League match in Australasia."
It is understood around 12,000 tickets have been sold for the ground, which has a capacity just over 16,000.
The Warriors' other pre-season matches are against the Adelaide Rams in Tonga on February 6 and the Western Reds in Wanganui on February 16.
